comment.author: 27339232@N07
comment._content: She doesn't look a day older than 25.

comment.author: 8879528@N05
comment._content: Something about that caption doesn't quite ring true.  The dimensions and near-center mount are consistent with the *barrel* of an M2A1 or M101 howitzer.  Note that the left end is turned down, which is characteristic of the breach end of the weapon.  She's using a micrometer to check a boss or flange of the outer diameter near the center mounting point, which is already greater than the roughly 4" ID of the barrel.  No "cutters" are evident, so there's no way one could be inserted *into* the barrel.  The castellated sleeve is probably internally threaded and engages the external threads seen on the barrel directly behind her.

comment.author: 44873393@N02
comment._content: I've found in military history research that many anomalies and aberrations occur between the photograph and the caption.  "Kurtz" said it best - "Photographers are not engineers".
